repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR adds pure python mode to parallelism.rst. Several minor improvements were added:

* Examples were fixed, ensured that example can be compiled and multiple fixes were introduced,
* Example was moved to a file to be checked by CI,
* Minor improvements to text formatting.

Related: #4187

comment_data.body: Presumably this needs to be part of ` from cython.cimports.openmp import omp_set_dynamic`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+# tag: openmp
+
+from cython.parallel import parallel
+from cython.cimports.openmp import omp_set_dynamic
+
+num_threads = cython.declare(cython.int)
+
+omp_set_dynamic(1)
+with cython.nogil, parallel():
+    num_threads = openmp.omp_get_num_threads()

comment_data.body: Hmm all examples I did check via compiling. Maybe I did copy-past error. Let me check
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+# tag: openmp
+
+from cython.parallel import parallel
+from cython.cimports.openmp import omp_set_dynamic

+num_threads = cython.declare(cython.int)
+
+omp_set_dynamic(1)
+with cython.nogil, parallel():
+    num_threads = openmp.omp_get_num_threads()

comment_data.body: Issue fixed. File now can be compiled by cython.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@

comment_data.body: I think you've forgotten to check breaking_loop.pyx into git
This doesn't quite look like it'll line up with the .py file
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+from cython.parallel import prange
+
+
+
+def func(double[:] x, double alpha):

comment_data.body: breaking_loop.pyx is already in GIT https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/docs/examples/userguide/parallelism/breaking_loop.pyx, there are no changes needed there so it is not included in PR.
Sorry you're quite right. Clearly I wasn't being very clever earlier...
But now I see that at least .pyx file needs alignment. I will fix it now.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+from cython.parallel import prange
+
+
+
+def func(double[:] x, double alpha):

commit.message: Add pure python mode to paralelism.rst

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: [Doc] Add pure python mode to parallelism.rst
